title: 79/291. World Horse Day
text:

A/RES/79/291 
 
General Assembly 
Distr.: General 
9 June 2025 
25-08974 (E) 
*2508974* 
 
 
Seventy-ninth session 
Agenda item 13 
Integrated and coordinated implementation of and follow-up 
to the outcomes of the major United Nations conferences and 
summits in the economic, social and related fields 
 
 
 
 
 Resolution adopted by the General Assembly 
on 3 June 2025 
 
 
[without reference to a Main Committee (A/79/L.89)] 
 
 
 79/291. World Horse Day 
 
 
 
The General Assembly, 
 
Reaffirming its resolution 70/1 of 25 September 2015, entitled “Transforming 
our world: the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development”, in which it adopted a 
comprehensive, far-reaching and people-centred set of universal and transformative 
Sustainable Development Goals and targets,  
 
Reaffirming also its resolutions 53/199 of 15 December 1998 and 61/185 of 
20 December 2006 on the proclamation of international years, and Economic and 
Social Council resolution 1980/67 of 25 July 1980 on international years and 
anniversaries, in particular paragraphs 1 to 10 of the annex thereto on the agreed 
criteria for the proclamation of international years, as well as paragraphs 13 and 14, 
in which it is stated that an international day or year should not be proclaimed before 
the basic arrangements for its organization and financing have been made,  
 
Emphasizing that at present there are over 57 million horses in the world and 
that in many countries the horse industry plays an important role in the socioeconomic 
development and well-being of people and the promotion of equine welfare and 
specifically contributes to the daily lives and economic empowerment of the rural 
population and local communities through riding, transportation, horse racing, 
equestrian sports, tourism and recreational activities, as well as employment 
generation, food production and other businesses,  
 
Recognizing the efforts of Member States to preserve and develop horse culture 
and heritage as well as the conservation of pastoral nomadic lifestyles,  
 
Acknowledging that both the number of horses and the equine industry are 
declining worldwide to some extent due to changes in lifestyles, pressure on the 
industry from economic fluctuations, climate change, and environmental and other 
factors,  

A/RES/79/291 
World Horse Day
 
25-08974
2/2 
 
 
Trusting that the designation of a World Horse Day would create a global 
platform for the international community to raise awareness of the importance of the 
horse and the equine industry in sustainable agriculture development,  
 
1. 
Decides to proclaim 11 July World Horse Day;  
 
2. 
Invites all Member States, organizations of the United Nations system, 
other international and regional organizations and other relevant stakeholders, 
including civil society, the private sector and academia, as well as schools, to observe 
World Horse Day, in an appropriate manner and in accordance with national priorities, 
through activities aimed at raising awareness among the public of the economic and 
social importance of the horse and the equine industry, encouraging the development 
of professional training, scientific research, the dissemination of best practices in the 
equine sector, and the promotion of equine welfare, preserving horse culture and 
heritage, and sharing knowledge, information, best practices and other collaborative 
approaches in this regard;  
 
3. 
Stresses that the cost of all activities that may arise from the 
implementation of the present resolution should be met by voluntary contributions 
and that such activities would be subject to the availability and provision of voluntary 
contributions;  
 
4. 
Requests the Secretary-General to bring the present resolution to the 
attention of all Member States, the organizations of the United Nations system and 
other relevant stakeholders, including civil society, Indigenous Peoples, the private 
sector and academia, for appropriate observance. 
 
73rd plenary meeting 
3 June 2025
